news_header: The European Stoxx 600 index rose by 0.2% on Wednesday, with the Food, Beverage & Tobacco sector showing the highest gains. Heineken's shares surged by 13% in early trading, driven by strong sales growth in Brazil, Mexico, and India. The company expects a 4-8% increase in operating results by 2025 and announced a €1.5 billion share repurchase program.
news_original_title: Euroopan pörssiavauksessa Heineken lähti rajuun nousuun olutvolyymien siivittämänä
news_text: Analysts view Heineken's outlook as positive, despite a 25% decline in shares over the past year. The Stoxx 600 index has increased by 8% this year, outperforming the S&P 500, as markets await U.S. inflation data.
